Method Detail

highlightTermDiffs

public static java.lang.String highlightTermDiffs(java.lang.String first, java.lang.String second)
Highlights the different terms in the second query and returns a new query string. Diffs are highlighted using #DEFAULT_DIFFS_HIGHLIGHT_PATTERN; for alternative formats use #highlightTermDiffs(String, String, String). This method is intended to be used with suggested queries to display the suggestion to the user in highlighted format, as per Google, so the queries are expected to roughly match
param:
first the original query
param:
second the second query, in which to highlight differences zero is the highlighted term text
return:
a new copy of second with term differences highlighted
throws:
ParseException if either first or second query is invalid
see:
#highlightTermDiffs(String, String, String)

highlightTermDiffs

public static java.lang.String highlightTermDiffs(java.lang.String first, java.lang.String second, java.lang.String highlightPattern)
Highlights the different terms in the second query and returns a new query string. This method is intended to be used with suggested queries to display the suggestion to the user in highlighted format, as per Google, so the queries are expected to roughly match
param:
first the original query
param:
second the second query, in which to highlight differences
param:
highlightPattern the pattern used to highlight; should be a MessageFormat pattern where argument zero is the highlighted term text
return:
a new copy of second with term differences highlighted
throws:
ParseException if either first or second query is invalid
see:
#highlightTermDiffs(String, String)
